channel.title: Binaural Doppler panner-patch
channel.description: Im trying to replicate this: https://mqtthiqs.github.io/parasites/warps.html#doppler and I think Im on theright track, but thought someone may be able to push this noob along... Binaural DopplerPanner.axp (3.1 KB) > _the Big knob sets x coordinate of the source._ > _the Small knob sets y coordinate of the source._ > _the Tiny pots control a built-in LFO modulating the source's position on a circle around the center (technically there are two LFOs in quadrature, modulating respectively x and y). The first is its frequency, the second is its amplitude._ > _the Two outputs should be used as a stereo pair, obviously._ > _Input 1 is one sound source; Input 2 is another source that is placed symmetrically to Input 1 on the other side of the head's axis._ Buzz is just an input... not relevant

item.title: Binaural Doppler panner-patch
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

Lissajous is an object that generates the coordinates for a Lissajous figure (with some variations on the theme, but that's it).
I don't think it's really relevant with binaural sound, i made it as an oscilloscope music ecperiment

Read full topic

item.title: Binaural Doppler panner-patch
item.dc:creator: @damonp Damon Palyka
item.description:
@damonp wrote:

Im trying to replicate this: https://mqtthiqs.github.io/parasites/warps.html#doppler
and I think Im on theright track, but thought someone may be able to push this noob along...
Binaural DopplerPanner.axp (3.1 KB)

the Big knob sets x coordinate of the source.
the Small knob sets y coordinate of the source.
the Tiny pots control a built-in LFO modulating the source's position on a circle around the center (technically there are two LFOs in quadrature, modulating respectively x and y). The first is its frequency, the second is its amplitude.
the Two outputs should be used as a stereo pair, obviously.
Input 1 is one sound source; Input 2 is another source that is placed symmetrically to Input 1 on the other side of the head's axis.

Buzz is just an input... not relevant

Read full topic
